content.question: A pathogenic bacterium has been engulfed by a phagocytic cell as part of the nonspecific (innate) immune response. Which of the following illustrations best represents the response?

choices.label: A phagocytic cell. A bacterium is engulfed by the cell. Ribosomes attach to and enter the phagosome containing the bacterium. After the ribosomes interact with the phagosome containing the bacterium it is depicted to contain small particles. The phagosome attaches to the outer membrane and releases the small particles outside of the cell.

A phagocytic cell. A bacterium is engulfed by the cell and is contained in a phagosome. Antibodies find and attach to the phagosome. After the antibody interacts with the phagosome it contains small particles in place of the single bacterium. The phagosome attaches to the outer membrane of the phagocytic cell and releases the small particles outside of the cell.

A phagocytic cell. A bacterium is engulfed by the cell. A lysosome finds and fuses to the phagosome containing the bacterium. After the lysosome interacts with the phagosome it is depicted to contain small particles. The phagosome attaches to the outer membrane of the phagocytic cell and releases the particles outside the cell.

A phagocytic cell. A bacterium is engulfed by the cell. A mitochondrion finds and fuses to the phagosome containing the bacterium. After the interaction with a mitochondrion, the phagosome now contains small particles. The phagosome attaches with the cell membrane and releases the small particles outside the cell.

content.answer: A phagocytic cell. A bacterium is engulfed by the cell. A lysosome finds and fuses to the phagosome containing the bacterium. After the lysosome interacts with the phagosome it is depicted to contain small particles. The phagosome attaches to the outer membrane of the phagocytic cell and releases the particles outside the cell.
